milestone.title: v3.7.1
milestone.description:
This version is about to release with Cocos v2.3.2.
The core feature is Skeleton Animation support for Cocos Studio
It will provide Skeleton Animation for TimelineAction, its cpp/json parser, Lua/JS bindings,  web implementation.

data.title: add api getStringUTFCharsJNI newStringUTFJNI
data.body:
improve getUTFCharsFromJavaEnv api to getStringUTFCharsJNI and add newStringUTFJNI

```
getUTFCharsFromJavaEnv:change jstring to utf8 std string
newStringUTFJNI:change utf8 std string to jstring
```

fix the getStringUTFCharsJNI string did not show correctly

data.title: Make viewport constructor more compile friendly
ProtectedNode中通过addProtectedChild()添加的子节点，触摸事件，不受节点树控制。
data.body: 在EventDispatcher中，对事件排序时，是根据事件所在节点，在节点树上的深度进行排序，但是ProtectedNode的派生类中，_protectedChildren中的直接点没有参与排序运算。

data.title: Improved EditBox implement for platform win32
data.body:
1. Associated button caption with 'ReturnType'
2. Re-implement the maximum input length
3. Associated win32 edit control style with some InputFlag and InputMode, such as InputFlag::PASSWORD, InputMode::NUMERIC
4. No longer block the rendering when the win32 dialog has not yet been closed
5. Invoke editBoxTextChanged when text in win32 edit control has been changed
6. Keep the displaying text of Label in EditBox synced between win32 edit control

data.title: Very Low Frame Rate on Samsung Galaxy Tab 4
data.body:
Hello

We tested our cocos2d-x v3.7 game on 20-25 different Android devices. It hardly passes 30 fps on Tab 4 while every other device (including Tab2 & Tab3) ran the game near 60fps. We tried everything from lowering resolutions of textures to changing pixel format but at the end we have found out that it's not really about our code because the game performs great even on slowest Android devices. 

Is there a special condition for Tab 4's GPU to prevent running Cocos2d-x engine at good performance? Can anything be done about this issue? Does anyone have further information on this matter?

Thanks.

data.title: Menu must receive touch ended event
data.body:
I have a simple menu with a menu item and I've placed a node that recognizes gestures in front of it. If my gesture recognizer detects a gesture it stops the touch ended event propagation so it won't trigger a button click on the button behind it. The problem is that once the touch ended event doesn't reach the menu the menu is no longer usable and it doesn't respond to any more touches.
From a quick look at the code it seems to be a problem with the _state member variable that is only reset in the touch ended method and if this function is not called even once the _state doesn't return to WAITING.

data.title: Set camera mask for new elements
data.body:
Hi

It is not obvious that I should write every time such thing

``` C++
auto sprite = //<some new 3d spite>
sprite->setCameraMask(getCameraMask());
addChild(sprite);
```

I think this behaviour should be by default

data.title: [Web][Bug] Conditions that canvas fail to bake layer
data.body:
Former modifications to bake layer in canvas rendering see #12213(cocos2d/cocos2d-x#12213)
There are still some abnormal phenomena exist (testcase in js-test/src folder):
## 1.drawCalls proliferating
- Cocos studio (e.g paser cocos studio 2.1)
- UI Button (e.g ignoreContentSize) 

drawCalls proliferate when layer is rotating in bake-condition.(normal in un-bake)
## 2.nodes with animation stop actions in baked layer
- Chipmunk Test
- Cocos studio Armature Test
- Spine Test (skeleton Animation)

Actions will be aborted in bake condition, where the layer outside should not be baked (child nodes inside are in action)
## 3.DOM node abnormal
- Extension/editBox

Test Drawcalls increase when layer roating ,no matter on bake or un-bake condition. Dom nodes refuse to transform with layer

@pandamicro
